intro: Petrocosmea henryi, commonly known as the Henry's rock orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, pale greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its roots are fibrous and well-developed for anchoring in rocky soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Petrocosmea henryi is considered a vulnerable species.
